name: Relating to consumer protection;  to require certain manufacturers of Internet-enabled devices to activate existing filters to restrict access to certain material;  to provide for a cause of action;  to provide civil penalties.
description: Requires tablet/smartphone manufacturers to have filters that can be enabled at activation and only bypassed or switched off with password.

name: To create the protection of minors from distribution of harmful material act;  to establish liability for the publication or distribution of material harmful to minors on the internet;  and to require reasonable age verification.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography.

name: To create the protection of minors from distribution of harmful material act;  to establish liability for the publication or distribution of material harmful to minors on the internet;  and to require reasonable age verification.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: To create the social media safety act;  to require age verification for use of social media;  and to clarify liability for failure to perform age verification for use of social media and illegal retention of data.
description: Requires age verification / parental consent to open social media accounts, with significant exclusions. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Business regulations: sexually explicit material
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: The California Age-Appropriate Design Code Act
description: Requires online services to submit risk assessments and mitigation plans for how their products might harm children;  estimate users' ages;  provide privacy protections for children. Establishes working group to advise legislature.

name: Features that harm child users: civil penalty
description: Prohibits social media platforms from design elements (not content) that result in specific harms to children (incl. self-harm and purchase of firearms);  platforms exempted if conducting quarterly audits and effecting mitigations.

name: Social media platforms: minor users: civil penalties
description: Prohibits social media platforms using ranking algorithms that prioritize engagement over well-being for minors.

name: An act concerning minors and social media accounts.
description: [Official summary as no bill text available] Requiring parental consent for under 16s to open social media accounts.

name: An act concerning minors and digital privacy.
description: [Official summary as no bill text available] Prohibits collection and commercial use of consumer data and personally identifiable information about minors

name: An act establishing a connecticut age-appropriate design code.
description: [Official summary as no bill text available] Requires online services to adopt privacy and safety measures for minors

name: An act concerning the creation of a state police investigative task force to address online sexual exploitation and abuse of minors.
description: Establishes state police task force to address online sexual abuse and exploitation of minors.

name: An act concerning online privacy, data and safety protections.
description: Omnibus including: requiring parental consent for under 16s to have social media accounts;  online services likely to be used by children have duty of care to avoid heightened risk to minors, must conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans, esp. regarding data collection;  collection / use of user data for minors highly restricted;  specific safety requirements;  establishes task force investigating & prosecuting internet crimes against children.

name: An act concerning social media and parental consent.
description: [Official summary as no bill text available] Requiring parental consent for under 16s to open social media accounts.

name: An act concerning cyberbullying.
description: [Official summary as no bill text available] Enforces age limits on social media usage;  require development of filters to curb cyberbullying.

name: Social Media Protection for Minors
description: Requires social media platforms predominantly used by minors to disclose policies, provide reporting features and parental settings, and display a warning.

name: Technology Transparency
description: Omnibus bill including: prohibiting causing harm to minors via processing of personal data;  use of user data for children highly restricted;  categorizes all personal data relating to minors as "sensitive."

name: Protection of Exploited Persons
description: Includes requiring age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Student Online Personal Information Protection
description: Significantly restricts school tech services' collection, use, and retention of student data, including prohibiting targeted advertising;  requires their adoption of reasonable data security practices.

name: Childhood Mental Health, Safety, and Welfare
description: Includes: requiring age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography (retaining ID information prohibited);  prohibiting use of student personal devices during school and posting student images to social media.

name: Student Technology Protection Act
description: Requires instructor and student education on safe use of technology;  tightens acceptable usage and filtering policies at schools.

name: PROTECTION OF MINORS – Adds to existing law to establish the Parental Rights Protection of Minors Act to protect minors from exposure to harmful materials on certain devices.
description: Requires tablet/smartphone manufacturers to have filters that are enabled at activation and only bypassed or switched off with password. Crime for non-parents to deactivate filter and allow minors to access harmful content.

name: PROTECTION OF MINORS – Adds to existing law to establish the Parental Rights Protection of Minors Act to protect minors from exposure to harmful materials on certain devices.
description: Requires tablet/smartphone manufacturers to have filters that are enabled at activation and only bypassed or switched off with password. Crime for non-parents to deactivate filter and allow minors to access harmful content.

name: Creates the Children's Privacy Protection and Parental Empowerment Act
description: Requires online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children;  estimate age of users;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted. Establishes working group to develop best practices.

name: Creates the Minor Online Data Privacy Act.
description: [No bill text available]

name: Internet safety curricula for schools
description: Permits schools to teach Internet safety and instructs state education department to create curricular materials  at, minimally, elementary and high school levels.

name: An Act relating to civil liability for commercial entities who publish or distribute material harmful to minors on the internet and providing penalties.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: An Act relating to social media users under eighteen years of age, making penalties applicable, and including applicability provisions.
description: Prohibits social media platforms from allowing under 18s having accounts.

name: An Act relating to social media data collection regarding children under eighteen years of age, providing civil penalties, and including applicability provisions.
description: Prohibits social media platforms from collecting personal information (broadly defined) about children without parental consent.

name: An Act relating to parental consent regarding internet sites for users under the age of sixteen, providing civil penalties, and including applicability provisions
description: Requires parental consent for under 16s to use social media or gaming platforms.

name: Requiring commercial entities that produce material harmful to minors on the internet to require age verification for access to such internet sites and establishing a civil cause of action against such commercial entities by persons harmed to recover actual and punitive damages, court costs and attorney fees.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Require commercial entities that produce material harmful to minors on the internet to require age verification for access to such internet sites, establishing a civil cause of action against such commercial entities by persons harmed to recover actual and punitive damages, court costs and attorney fees.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Removing liability protections from online platforms and requiring certain wireless communication devices to have a default setting notifying parents of application downloads.
description: Declares that algorithmic recommendation of certain harmful content is not protected by §230.  Requires mobile device vendors to alert parents whenever a child downloads an app.

name: AN ACT relating to consumer data privacy.
description: General data privacy act that categorizes all personal data relating to minors as "sensitive."

name: AN ACT relating to the protection of minors.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Provides for attorney general investigation for publishers and distributors of material harmful to minors
description: Adds civil action for AG to the provisions of HB 142 (2022) / Act 440

name: Provides for liability for publishers and distributors of material harmful to minors
description: Require age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Creates the Secure Online Child Interaction and Age Limitation Act.
description: Requires parental approval for minors to have social media accounts;  requires age verification. Minor accounts: limited discoverability and communication;  allow parental access;  limited data use;  curfewed by default;  parents can set time limits.

name: An Act to Protect Children by Modernizing Internet and Digital Media Filtering Requirements for Education
description: Requires schools to use pornography filters on their networks and devices.

name: Consumer Protection – Social Media Regulation and Safety for Children
description: Prohibits under 13s having social media accounts;  platforms must identify and offer deletion for accounts of under 13s;  requires establishment of option of minor-parent joint accounts;  establishes fund for digital citizenship education.

name: Consumer Protection - Online Products and Services - Children's Data
description: Require online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children through data retention or algorithms;  estimate age of users;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted.

name: Commercial Law - Protection of Minors From Unfiltered Tablets or Smart Phones
description: Require tablet/smartphone manufacturers to have filters that are enabled at activation and only bypassed or switched off with password.

name: Consumer Protection – Online Products and Services – Children’s Data
description: Require online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children;  estimate age of users;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted.

name: An Act relative to internet privacy rights for children
description: Prohibits internet services from advertising or marketing harmful products (incl. weapons, tobacco, lottery tickets, pornography, spray paint) to minors;  requires internet services to facilitate the removal of minors' posted content when requested.

name: An Act relative to student and educator data privacy
description: Significantly restricts school tech vendors' use of student data and require data security practices;  requires that contracts between schools and vendors detail privacy and data security issues;  instruct the creation and implementation of data security and privacy regulations for educational entities.

name: An Act concerning media literacy in schools
description: Directs department of education to integrate media literacy, including Internet safety, into K-12 education.

name: An Act relative to the enticement of children online
description: Adds online approaches to the established offence of enticement.

name: An Act relative to transmitting indecent visual depictions by teens and the unlawful distribution of explicit images
description: Creates diversion program for teenagers regarding sexting and cyberbullying;  creates offence of distributing intimate images in cyberbullying context;  revises related penalties.

name: An Act establishing the Massachusetts Data Privacy Protection Act
description: Includes prohibition on targeted advertising to minors and requirement to assess and mitigate privacy risks to minors.

name: An Act relative to student and educator data privacy
description: Significantly restricts school tech vendors' use of student data and require data security practices;  requires that contracts between schools and vendors detail privacy and data security issues;  instruct the creation and implementation of data security and privacy regulations for educational entities.

name: An Act relative to transmitting indecent visual depictions by teens and the unlawful distribution of explicit images
description: Creates diversion program for teenagers regarding sexting and cyberbullying;  creates offence of distributing intimate images in cyberbullying context;  revises related penalties.

name: An Act relative to transmitting indecent visual depictions by teens and the unlawful distribution of explicit images
description: Creates diversion program for teenagers regarding sexting and cyberbullying;  creates offence of distributing intimate images in cyberbullying context;  revises related penalties.

name: Social media algorithms that target children prohibited.
description: Prohibits social media platforms serving content to minors via recommendation algorithms (except search results). Require parental consent for minors to open accounts.

name: Human Trafficking and Child Exploitation Prevention Act established, rulemaking provided, and report required.
description: Requires device retailers to have web filters that are enabled at activation and only disabled by adults paying a fee.

name: Minnesota Age-Appropriate Design Code Act created, obligations placed on businesses regarding children's consumer information, and attorney general enforcement provided.
description: Requires online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children;  estimate age of users;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted.

name: Human Trafficking and Child Exploitation Prevention Act
description: Requires device retailers to have web filters that are enabled at activation and only disabled by adults paying a fee.

name: Certain social media algorithms that target children prohibition
description: Prohibits social media platforms serving content to minors via recommendation algorithms (except search results). Require parental consent for minors to open accounts.

name: Minnesota Age-Appropriate Design Code Act
description: Requires online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children;  estimate age of users;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted.

name: Minors;  hold entities that publish harmful material on the internet civilly liable if age vertification is not performed.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Digital or online resources or databases;  require vendors to verify technology protection for persons under 15.
description: Includes: requiring online content vendors to schools to use filters;  prohibiting enticing minors to sexual acts via online communication.

name: Pornographic online and digital/resources for K-12 students;  prohibit
description: Requires online content vendors to schools to use filters.

name: Material harmful to minors;  provide for liability for any entity that distributes on the internet without age verification.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Material harmful to minors;  provide for liability for any entity that distributes on the internet without age verification
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Requires internet service providers to authenticate access to obscene websites and provide subscribers the ability to create an authentication to access such websites
description: Requires that ISPs enable a web filtering service, bypassable with passcode. Prohibits sharing code with minor.

name: Generally revise pupil data privacy protections
description: Limits use of facial recognition in schools to specific purposes and prohibits vendors from using that data beyond providing the service;  tightens up existing data privacy rules in schools.

name: Revise internet laws related to material harmful to minors
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography. Retaining ID information prohibited.

name: Create the offense of digital grooming and prohibit using an electronic communication device or social media to engage in certain conduct with minors
description: Prohibits online communication by adults with under 16s to entice sexual activity.

name: Provide requirements regarding access to digital and online resources provided for students by school districts, schools, and the Nebraska Library Commission
description: Requiring online content vendors to schools to use filters and provide parental access to content accessed by their child.

name: Establishes provisions relating to Internet privacy. (BDR 52-589)
description: Requires online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted.

name: making an appropriation to support the work of the New Hampshire Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force
description: Appropriates funding for the New Hampshire Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force.

name: AN ACT relative to the expectation of privacy.
description: General data privacy bill that categorizes all personal data relating to minors as "sensitive."

name: Provides that required instruction on sexual abuse and assault awareness and prevention in grades preschool through 12 include content on Internet safety and dangers of online predators.
description: Adds Internet safety / online predators to PS-12 sexual abuse awareness and prevention curriculum.

name: Establishes "Internet Predator Investigation and Prosecution Fund" with $200 assessment on persons convicted of certain offenses.
description: Establishes fund for AG to investigate and prosecute enticement of minors via the Internet with $200 fines from those convicted of hacking crimes or sexual offences.

name: One Strike, You're Ours;  adds use of Internet as aggravating factor in child sex crimes and requires lifetime electronic monitoring of offender.
description: Adds use of Internet as aggravating factor in child sex crimes and requires lifetime electronic monitoring of offenders.

name: Human Trafficking and Child Exploitation Prevention Act;  requires Internet-connected devices to have blocking capability in certain circumstances.
description: Requires device manufacturers/ retailers to have filters;  when sold to minor pornography blocking must be enabled at activation;  CSAM, NCII, child trafficking and prostitution blocked for all;  filters only disabled by adults paying a fee.

name: Requires sex offenders to report Internet identifiers and name changes.
description: Requires sex offenders to report Internet identifiers.

name: Concerns social media privacy and data management for children and establishes New Jersey Children's Data Protection Commission.
description: Require online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children, especially relating to data collection;  estimate age of users;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted. Establishes working group to develop best practices.

name: Prohibits social media platforms from using certain practices or features that cause child users to become addicted to platform.
description: Prohibits social media platforms from using design that is addictive to minors;  exempts those that conduct quarterly assessments and mitigations.

name: Provides that required instruction on sexual abuse and assault awareness and prevention in grades preschool through 12 include content on Internet safety and dangers of online predators.

description: Requires online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children, especially relating to data collection;  estimate age of users;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted. Establishes working group to develop best practices.

name: Prohibits social media platforms from using certain practices or features that cause child users to become addicted to platform.
description: Prohibits social media platforms from using design that is addictive to minors;  exempts those that conduct quarterly assessments and mitigations.

name: Age Appropriate Design Code Act
description: Requires online services likely to be used by children to prioritize the well-being of children over commercial interests;  conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children;  estimate ages of users;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users. Use of user data for children highly restricted.

name: Directs the commissioner of education to appoint a media literacy advisory group to study the teaching of media literacy;  requires such group to survey all school districts
description: Establishes advisory committee to make recommendations regarding teaching media literacy, including Internet safety, in schools.

name: Directs the commissioner of education to appoint a media literacy advisory committee to study the teaching of media literacy;  requires such committee to annually review policy on media literacy
description: Establishes advisory committee to make recommendations regarding teaching media literacy, including Internet safety, in schools.

name: Prevents interactive computer service providers from knowingly or negligently promoting developed content that is dangerous or otherwise injurious to minors
description: Prohibits online services harming minors by serving them targeted content that they (at least partially) developed.

name: Relates to creating a set of media literacy standards for students in grades kindergarten through twelve
description: Requires K-12 school to add media literacy to the curriculum, including Internet safety and privacy.

name: Prohibits cyber-bullying
description: Creates offence of cyberbullying.

name: Relates to enacting the New York child data privacy and protection act
description: Requires online services likely to be used by children to conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users;  parents must consent to accept Terms of Use and privacy policy. AG bureau of Internet and technology may ban specific features. Use of user data for children highly restricted.

name: Offers parental controls for internet services
description: Requires ISPs to make filtering and tracking software available to parents.

name: Relates to the uniform employee and student online privacy protection act
description: Includes privacy protections for student data, especially login credentials.

name: Relates to prohibiting a person required to register under the sex offender registration act from possessing an online gamer account
description: Prohibits registered sex offenders from having gaming accounts.

name: Prevents interactive computer service providers from knowingly or negligently promoting developed content that is dangerous or otherwise injurious to minors

AG Bureau of Internet and Technology may ban specific features. Use of user data for children highly restricted.

name: Relates to the registration information required to be reported by a sex offender
description: Includes adding Internet identifiers to sex offenders register.

name: Relates to the regulation of social media companies and social media platforms
description: Requires parental approval for minors to have social media accounts;  requires age verification. Minor accounts: limited discoverability and communication;  allow parental access;  limited data use;  curfewed by default;  parents can set time limits.

name: Age Verification to Protect Children Act.
description: Requires age verification to access websites that are more than one-third pornography.

name: Social Media Algorithmic Control in IT Act.
description: Prohibits social media platforms using minor users' data for recommendation algorithms and targeted advertising. Establishes task force to report on data privacy and social media [precise remit unclear].

name: Let Parents Choose/Sammy's Law of 2023
description: Requires social media platforms to make APIs available to facilitate the development and use of third-party safety software to control / monitor platform settings and interactions. Platforms must obtain and renew state permits.

name: [R]elating to the definition of a public library and required safety policies and technology protection measures;  ... relating to obscenity control;  to provide a penalty;  and to provide for application.
description: Requires online content vendors to schools (and libraries when making content available to school-age children) to use filters.

name: Regards education records and student data privacy
description: Strictly limits school tech vendors' use of student data;  prohibits schools and vendors tracking or recording students via devices.

name: Human trafficking and child exploitation;  creating the Human Trafficking and Child Exploitation Prevention Act;  directing retailers of Internet-enabled devices to equip products with certain filters;  codification;  effective date.
description: Requires device retailers / manufacturers to have filters that are enabled at activation and only disabled by adults paying a fee.

name: Relating to business's use of age-appropriate design
description: Requires online services likely to be used by children to prioritize the well-being of children over commercial interests;  conduct impact assessments and mitigation plans for harm to children;  default privacy settings to most protective for child users;  enforce their own policies. Use of user data for children highly restricted. Establishes task force to report on best practices.

description: Replaces references "child pornography" with "child sexual abuse material" in existing law.

name: An Act amending the act of November 30, 2004 (P.L.1556, No.197), known as the Child Internet Protection Act, further providing for title and for definitions;  and making editorial changes.
description: Replaces references "child pornography" with "child sexual abuse material" in existing law.

name: AN ACT RELATING TO EDUCATION -- STUDENT COMPUTER DEVICE PRIVACY
description: Prohibits schools and vendors tracking or recording students via devices in most cases.

name: AN ACT RELATING TO COMMERCIAL LAW -- GENERAL REGULATORY PROVISIONS -- RHODE ISLAND DATA TRANSPARENCY AND PRIVACY PROTECTION ACT (Provides data privacy protections for the personal identifiable information of Rhode Islanders.)
description: General data privacy bill that categorizes all personal data relating to children as "sensitive";  prohibits processing or selling personal data of minor customers.

description: General data privacy bill that categorizes all personal data relating to children as "sensitive";  prohibits processing or selling personal data of minor customers.

name: Relating to prohibiting social media platforms from using certain social media algorithms to target minors.

For minor accounts: messaging and discoverability limited, advertising, suggestions, and most data collection prohibited;  curfew enabled. Parents to receive access to posts by minor and ability to set time limits.

description: Appropriates funds for the Vermont Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force and creates three staff positions.

name: Consumer Data Protection Act;  protections for children, definition of verifiable parental consent
description: Requires parental consent for minor accounts with services that process data, or to collect and use minors' data;  prohibits sale of minors' personal data, or using it for targeted advertising. Raises age of majority in existing data protection law to 18.
